EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: FOREIGN MISSIONS AND INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS ACT

Identification.ShortTitle: Asian Development Bank Privileges and Immunities Order
Identification.LongTitle: Order Respecting the Privileges and Immunities of the Asian Development Bank in Canada

Section.Text: This Order may be cited as the Asian Development Bank Privileges and Immunities Order.

Definition.Text: Convention means the Convention on the Privileges and Immunities of the United Nations; (Convention)
Organization means the Asian Development Bank. (Organisation)

Subsection.Text: The Organization shall have in Canada the legal capacities of a body corporate and shall, to such extent as it may require, have the privileges and immunities set forth in Articles II and III of the Convention.

Representatives of states and governments that are members of the Organization shall, to such extent as may be required for the performance of their functions, have the privileges and immunities set forth in Article IV of the Convention for representatives of Members.

All officials of the Organization in Canada shall, to such extent as may be required for the performance of their functions, have the privileges and immunities set forth in Article V of the Convention for officials of the United Nations.

All experts performing missions for the Organization in Canada shall, to such extent as may be required for the performance of their functions, have the privileges and immunities set forth in Article VI of the Convention for experts on missions for the United Nations.

Section.Text: Nothing in this Order exempts any person who is a Canadian citizen resident or ordinarily resident in Canada from any taxes or duties imposed by any law in Canada.
